poem:
### Easter Truce

In Kyiv, a bell tolls beneath clouded sky,  
candles flicker against the forlorn breath  
of unkept promises. Shells like thunder  
mark the hours, smothering the dawn.  
In whispered prayers, hope flickers but  
the truce is paper-thin, a fleeting pause —  
time unravels quickly, in hurried hand,  
yet beneath the rubble, new resolve blooms.
